activities: Cook Research Incorporated  receives data from the EU that may contain information related to clinical research subjects, clinical research investigators and research staff responsible for the conduct of clinical research, medical and healthcare professionals, HR data on Cook Research Incorporated employees involved in clinical research, patient information used in the planning of procedures and sizing of commercially available and investigational  devices, patient information sent to Cook Research Incorporated as part of a quality complaint, and patient information and tissue related to explanted devices returned to Cook Research Incorporated.  Cook Research Incorporated may use this data as part of the operations of the company’s business including but not limited to clinical research involving medical products, patient safety and quality improvement, and compliance with regulatory authority obligations and requirements.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: Unresolved complaints will be referred to the EU Data Protection Authorities.
